Minister bats for cleaner Madurai, urges.description: MADURAI: Minister for cooperation Sellur K Raju has urged the residents to use dustbins to collect garbage and dispose it only with the sanitation employees of the Madurai Corporation. The local minister took part in a sensitization programme in Bethaniyapuram on Saturday to insist on cleanliness. At a time when Madurai is transforming into a smarter city under the Smart City mission, he wanted cooperation from the public to make it even more cleaner. After distributing dustbins to residents, Raju said that the cleaning of Chinthamani channel at Bethaniyapuram, which was clogged with garbage dumped by residents, is underway. The corporation is set to start cleaning all the 13 channels including Pandhalkudi, Managiri, Bibikulam, Kosakulam, Vilangudi, Avaniyapuram and Sottathatti soon. He urged them not use the channels to litter garbage and instead use dustbins. He also flagged off a few battery-operated vehicles to collect garbage from households. Corporation commissioner S Visakan and various other officials were present during the sensitization programme. TNN Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Minister opens fifth phase of excavation.description: SIVAGANGA: Putting an end to the controversy over the delay in starting the fifth phase of excavation at Keezhadi in Sivaganga district, minister for Tamil language, culture and archaeology, Mafoi K Pandiarajan officially inaugurated the work with a puja and said that the site museum at Keezhadi would come up on two acres and it would be curated in six months. Speaking to reporters after symbolically initiating the works with a pickaxe, he said that the foundation stone for the site museum would be laid soon. Keezhadi excavation was being conducted by the Tamil Nadu archaeological department. While the first three phases were conducted by Archaeological Survey of India, the fourth and now the fifth phases were being conducted by the state department. A total of 13,638 artefacts had been unearthed during the first four phases. The first three phases of excavations that took place between 2014 and 2017 had found 7,818 articles used by the people of the ancient era, while the fourth phase between 2017 and 2018 had unearthed 5,820 things. Site museums were to be established in Keezhadi, Korkai, Alagankulam and Athichanallur, he said. The state had 36 museums and six more were to be established this year. Next year, museums would be established in Tirupur and Namakkal. He said that the artefacts unearthed at Keezhadi would be sent to the US for carbon dating and the age of the ancient articles would be determined through fluorescence dating, a facility available in India. The fifth phase would be short and take about four to five months where fifteen trenches would be dug. This was the first time that underground structures had been identified using geomagnetism, which was more accurate and could define the structures sharply, he said. The expertise of Indian Institute of Geomagnetism is being used for this purpose, he added. The excavation in the fifth phase was to be carried out at a cost of Rs 47 lakh with deputy director of archaeology, Dr R Sivanantham, who led the fourth phase, conducting the fifth phase as well, he said. Pandiarajan said that they had found evidence from the four excavations that Keezhadi was as important as Mohenjo-Daro and Harappa. It was believed that Keezhadi was a site, where a riverside civilization and urban civilization merged. The minister said that the 35 trenches that had been dug before had been covered with sand after marking them. However, in future they may open them and make it a visiting tourist spot, like Mohenjo-Daro and Harappa after acquiring the land, but it was not an immediate plan. The minister said that they had received the reports of the Athichanallur excavation after a delay of 17 years and that it would be released by chief minister Edapaddi K Palaniswami soon along with the proposed perception plan for archaeology in the state. He added that they were yet to receive the reports of the first two phases of Keezhadi excavation from the ASI. The current period was the golden era for state archaeology with many excavation and restoration works being undertaken simultaneously. Twelve fortresses including the Thirumalai Naicker Mahal in Madurai were to be renovated at a cost of Rs 24 crore, he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Unable to repay loan, farmer ends life.description: A 56-year-old farmer from Theni district committed suicide unable to repay an agricultural loan that he had taken from a private bank a couple of years ago. He consumed poison on Thursday and was admitted in a hospital, where he died not responding to treatment on Friday. Based on a complaint from the farmer’s son J Malaisamy, 32, a case under Section CrPc 174 (suspicious death) was registered with the Mayiladumparai police and an inquiry was underway. The deceased was identified as M Jayakodi from Kumananthozhu village. According to police, he had pledged a piece of his land measuring five acres to get Rs 5 lakh loan from a private bank branch in Kumananthozhu. TNN Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Now, posters supporting OPS surface in A.description: Madurai: Even as the AIADMK barred its members from talking to the media, posters urging deputy chief minister O Panneerselvam to assume charge as the leader of the party have been pasted in many parts of Andipatti constituency in Theni district by his supporters. It may be recalled that Madurai North MLA V V Rajan Chellappa had sought a single leadership for the AIADMK as was the case during Jayalalithaa’s era which caused quite a flutter in political circles. Following this, the party high command had convened a meeting in Chennai and asked its members to refrain from talking to the media. However, even as the meeting was being held in Chennai, posters supporting chief minister Edapaddi K Palaniswami for leader and another demanding that education minister K A Sengottaiyan be made the leader emerged, both demanding a single leadership. Now, posters demanding that deputy chief minister O Panneerselvam take up the leadership have appeared at many places in Andipatti. These posters hail Panneerselvam as the person who was chosen by Jayalalithaa to be chief minister thrice and calls him the “Dharmayudh hero’’. The posters have the photograph of Jayalalithaa and OPS printed on them. While they have been signed by the cadres of ‘Dharmayudham’, the photographs of former urban district secretary of AIADMK M Ramachandran and Theni cultural wing secretary A Vellaipandian are also printed on them. It may be recalled that AIADMK had lost the Andipatti bypoll to the DMK and it was alleged that Panneerselvam’s support was dwindling in the region. Woman who set herself ablaze over murder.description: Madurai: A 26-year-old woman from the Perumalpuram Sri Lankan refugee camp in Kanyakumari district, who had been battling for life after setting herself ablaze on June 7, died at the government medical college and hospital at Asaripallam on Wednesday. Anusha had resorted to the extreme step after being unable to bear the murder of her lover by her brother and his accomplices.Her lover Rasee, 34, was a resident of the refugee camp at Samugarangapuram village near Valliyoor in Tirunelveli district. A divorcee, he had a photography studio at Valliyoor where Anusha’s brother Kaydheeswaran, 25, was an assistant. The police said that though the girl’s family opposed the love affair, the duo was hell-bent on getting married. This infuriated Kaydheeswaran who thought of getting rid of Rasee. Early on June 6, the burnt body of Rasee was found in a crematorium at Kariyamanickapuram village near Kanyakumari. Kottar police who investigated the case found injuries on his neck and sent the body to the government hospital for autopsy.There was some difficulty in identifying the man as the body was fully burnt. Based on a tip about Rasee having gone missing from the refugee camp for two days, the police started probing in that direction and nabbed Kaydheeswaran the same day. He confessed to murdering the man by taking him in a taxi, getting him drunk and stabbing him with a broken liquor bottle.He committed the crime with the help of his accomplices Palani alias Kannan, 25, of Suchindram and Faizal, 26, of Paramarthilingapuram, who were also arrested by the police. The trio was booked under sections 302 (punishment for murder) and 201 (causing disappearance of evidence of offence, or giving false information to screen offender) of the Indian Penal Code. Zero discharge textile processing park t.description: MADURAI: A Rs 200 crore zero-waste textile processing park, which would be a boon to the textile industry in the state to get rid of effluent, is to come up at Kariapatti in Virudhunagar district on the border with Madurai. This was revealed at a press meet organized to announce the textile expo to be held from June 18 to 21 at Madurai District Tiny and Small-Scale Industries Association (Maditssia). Project director of the textile processing park K R Gnanasambandan said that they were in the process of seeking permission for the foundation stone laying ceremony of the park which is to be spread over 100 acres. He said the park would be established in a year. As in other districts, textiles had been flourishing in Madurai and the southern districts too with about 75 units functioning well till recently in Madurai alone. However, about 35 of them had closed down thanks to the issue of pollution.  The remaining ones were suspended because power supply was stopped over the issue. Gnanasambandan said that the textile processing park project was signed by late chief minister J Jayalalithaa at the 2015 Global Investors Meet and Maditssia was the first to take up the offer. ``The central government will contribute Rs 100 crore and the state government and Maditssia Rs 50 crore each for this park,’’ he said. It had taken them five years to get clearances at different levels, including the most important one on pollution from the Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board, and other environmental clearances. The park would house 40 textile units which would be relocated into the park from in and around Madurai. The units would bleach and dye textiles, but there would be zero discharge. He said that 96% of the water from the park would be recycled while the remaining 4 %, which was sludge, would be sent to the evaporator. The water in the sludge would evaporate and the remaining solid, which was predominantly lime, would be sent to the cement industry. He said that the park could help rejuvenate the textile industry throughout the state as it would help them with the crucial functions of bleaching and dyeing. All types of yarn could be processed here. Once functional, the park would provide direct employment to 2,000 people and indirect employment to over 5,000 people, he added. Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Man gets bail on making amends about FB.description: Madurai: The Madurai bench of the Madras high court has granted anticipatory bail to a person who posted a controversial comment on his Facebook page. When the petition was taken up for hearing on Friday, the counsel who appeared for the petitioner submitted an undertaking by the petitioner before the court stating that he would not post such comments in future. On perusal of the submissions, justice P Rajamanickam granted anticipatory bail. In his petition, Imran alias Mohamadu Imran alias Mohamed Imran, a resident of Mallipattinam in Thanjavur district, stated that the Sethubavachatiram police have registered a case against him under Sections 296 (A), 505 (1) (b), 505 (2) of IPC and Section 67 of the Information Technology Act. He submitted that the case was registered for his post on his Facebook page telling Muslims that they should either learn ‘jihad’ or should learn to chant ‘Jai Shri Ram’ which could instigate violence between people belonging to two religions. Stating that he was falsely implicated in this case, Imran said that he did not have any bad antecedents in the Sethubavachatiram and Mallipattinam police limits. He stated that in 2015, three cases were registered against him at police stations in Madurai, Tirunelveli and Kanyakumari districts as he gave legal assistance to Muslim prisoners and educational support to their children. As no such occurrence happened on the day which was mentioned in the complaint, the petitioner prayed to the high court seeking anticipatory bail stating that he is willing to abide by the rules of the court. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. \u2018State will not allow projects agai.description: Stating that the government is getting public opinion regarding the proposed ‘away from reactor spent fuel storage facility’ at the Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant (KKNPP) in Tirunelveli district, minister for environment K C Karuppannan said that the government will not go ahead with any project that is against the interests of the people. Speaking to reporters in Tuticorin after taking part in various events, including an environment-related conference at a private college in Kovilpatti and tree planting events on Friday, Karuppannan said that this applies to the Sterlite copper smelter plant as well that has remained sealed from May 2018. Smoke emanating from all factories in the State Industries Promotion Corporation of Tamil Nadu Limited (Sipcot) industrial estates across the state is being monitored by the department of environment. “Devices have been installed at industries where excess smoke gets emanated. It is being monitored from the pollution control board office and when the pollution level crosses the limit the plants will be temporarily closed,” he said. The industries are allowed to resume operation only after they carryout corrective measures. Pointing out at the United Nations’ World Environment Day celebration for this year ‘Beat Air Pollution’, he said that the government is determined to create awareness on the same and to carry out rectification measures to reduce air pollution. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Chamber wants 28% slab abolis.description: MADURAI: Tamil Nadu Chamber of Commerce and Industry has made an appeal to union Finance Minister (FM) Nirmala Sitharaman to abolish the highest tax slab of 28% from Goods and Services Tax (GST). In a pre-budget memorandum to the minister, the chamber’s senior president S Rethinavelu and president N Jegatheesan stated that doing away with the 28 per cent tax slab and reducing the tax rates in the other categories would result in better compliance and reflect with increase in tax paid to the government. Lauding the government for reducing GST on various goods from 28% to 18 % at the 28th meeting of the GST Council on July 21, 2018, they pointed out that as many as 28 items including cement and automobile parts are still under the 28 per cent slab. They said that goods that have to be placed under the 12% slab are in the 18% category and this applies to the 12% and 5 % categories as well. The chamber pressed for 18 per cent as highest GST and that it should be applicable only to sin and luxury goods. Suggesting a new Revenue Neutral Rate (RNR) at 15%, they said that the tax slab of existing goods should be reduced to 15%, 12%, 5 % and zero per cent, respectively, from the existing slabs. According to the chamber, all homogenous products should have the same rate to avoid any confusion in the tax rate. “What is wrong in fixing the same tax rate on fabric stitched or unstitched? Similarly, there are several items to be simplified. We sincerely hope the FM would rationalize the classification of products under different slab rates,” Rethinavelu said. They sought inclusion of representatives of leading chambers of commerce from all States in the GST Council for enlisting their views and suggestions. They pointed out that businessmen and manufactures are among the main stakeholders in the GST system. They claimed that they are not given an opportunity to directly put forth their suggestions to the GST Council. The chamber stated that dealers are forced to spend much more on GST compliance compared to general sales tax and value added tax. “The existing system is so complicated that the MSME sector has to spend a monthly consulting fee of Rs 3,000 to Rs 5,000 and up to Rs 30,000 annually for the annual return and certification. E-invoice will be a solution to this problem to a great extent,” Rethinavelu said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Plea to make Chennai weekly train tri-we.description: MADURAI: Kanyakumari District Railway Users' Association (KKDRUA) has appealed to Southern Railways (SR) to increase the frequency of trains 12689/12690 Chennai Central - Nagercoil weekly overnight superfast express to tri-weekly. In representations to SR general manager and top officials in the Madurai and Thiruvananthapuram railway divisions and MLAs, the association requested for diversion of the trains through Madurai, Dindigul, Karur, Namakkal and Salem, without touching Tiruchirappalli route. KKDRUA secretary P Edward Jeni said this was the only weekly train connecting Jolarpettai, Katpadi, Arakkonam and Tiruvallur to the southern districts of Tamil Nadu. “A large number of students from southern districts are studying in VIT and institutions in the northern region. Many patients from the south also go to Christian Medical College in Vellore for treatment,” he said. The train also is used by a large number of patients getting treated at CMC, he added. The association said the unavailability of more services is forcing commuters to use buses that are not only expensive but also not as convenient. Private buses charge the full fare till Chennai even if they get down en route, he said. Increasing the frequency of the Chennai Central – Nagercoil trains will also facilitate using Chennai Central as a transit point to northern destinations. The DRUA expressed concern at reports that the Thiruvananthapuram division proposed to extend Train No 16349/16350 Kochuveli – Nilambur Road Rajya Rani Express till Nagercoil, saying it would make it impossible to increase the frequency of the Chennai Central – Nagercoil junction express into tri-weekly. BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Theni SP among 10 personnel injured as p.description: Theni: Ten police personnel including the superintendent of police, V VBaskaran suffered injuries when a group of villagers, who were staging a road blockade, pelted stones on them while they tried to pacify the protesters. The incident took place in a village near Periyakulam on Friday night. Baskaran suffered an injury below his eye when a stone hit him. He was initially treated at the Theni Medical College Hospital, before being shifted to a private hospital in Madurai. He was later shifted to a private eye hospital. A doctor treating him said that it was a minor injury and there was no threat to his eyesight. “We have advised hospitalization for one more day just to ensure that he takes rest. We are treating him to reduce pain and swollen muscles,” said the doctor. Higher police officers including ADGP Jayanth Murali, Madurai city police commissioner S Davidson Devasirvatham and south zone IG K P Shanmuga Rajeswaran visited the injured SP in hospital. Meanwhile, the Thenkarai police have registered a case against a few people from Saruthupatti village, who took part in the protest. “An FIR has been registered. We have arrested five people so far and searching for a few more,” said inspector Mathana Kala. Around 400 police personnel have been deployed in the village and the suspects are being combed. Police said that it all began when a police constable identified as Siranjeevi attached to Devadhanapatti police station, and hailing from Saruthupatti village, claimed that he was attacked by some members of an intermediate caste from Lakshmipuram at Pomminayakkanpatti. This created tension and as a result the villagers staged a blockade on the Theni-Periyakulam road seeking the arrest of the ‘suspects’. “The police constable made a false claim to give a communal twist. Inquiry is underway to find out the reason. While there has been mounting tension between the two castes in the last three days, the villagers began a protest,” a police officer said. As traffic was affected on the road, SP Baskaran along with others arrived at the spot. After a while, when things went out of control and the protesters started pelting stones resulting in injuries to the police personnel. Police had to resort to a lathicharge after the stone pelting incident to disburse the crowd. Adequate strength has been deployed in all vulnerable areas and things are under control. There will not be any further escalation of tension, said deputy superintendent police, Periyakulam range, V Arumugam. Police sources said the tension between two castes in Periakulam region started on June 12, when a couple of youngsters from scheduled caste were questioned by members of the intermediate caste from Lakshmipuram for speeding through the street. While the duo left, they came back later and attacked those who questioned them. This led to people from Lakshmipuram stage a road blockade on June 13. They reportedly attacked a couple of students belonging to the scheduled caste from another village, when they were passing through the protest. Left to the mercy of social activists in.description: Madurai: The digital era is distancing people from one another, but nowhere is it felt as glaringly as in the funerals of elders from oldage homes which are often not attended by their children or relatives. The responsibility of fulfilling the last wishes of these hapless people is left to socially concerned people like V P Manikandan who attends to about two such funerals a week. Adviser of Aishwarayam Trust, a hospice and palliative care centre, Manikandan arrives at the spot whenever his help is needed for a social cause like taking care of the injured, finding a home for abandoned people or at an accident spot. But the one job he does promptly is visit the dozens of free oldage homes in the city, where elderly persons yearn for the visit of a loved one. ``Many of them look up to me like a relative and it becomes our responsibility to take care of their last rites. Funerals that need the attention of social activists are increasing in the city today,’’ he said. Sometimes, he bears the responsibilities of about two to three funerals a week, especially in the winter season in these homes. He also gets information of people dying orphaned on the roadside and in the GRH, when he pools money for the rites. A simple funeral costs about Rs 5,000, including ambulance expenditure, cremation ground services and rituals. ``It is disheartening not just because the deceased was a known person, but due to the attitude of their relatives. They do not come forward to receive the body for fear of having to bear the expenses. I do it with the help of friends and kind-hearted people who contribute to the cause,’’ he said. What is really depressing is when the people in these homes ask him if he would perform the last rites for them too, like he did for another inmate. ``When I go to the home a day after the funeral this is a common question I face. I avoid going there because there is nothing more heart-wrenching than to hear a mother or a father ask an unknown person to give them the final farewell,’’ he said. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Gaping holes on pavement at Anna Nagar p.description: MADURAI: Walking on the middle of the road is no doubt suicidal, but in Anna Nagar, walking along the pavement meant for pedestrians can be even more dangerous. Chances are that your leg will get caught in a deep gaping hole on the one-kilometre stretch. The stretch of the 80 feet road on Anna Nagar main road, from Ambiga theatre to Golcha complex, has a pavement bordering the road continuously except at places where the streets intercept. The elevated pavement has been laid over a drainage. Morning walkers are seen walking along this stretch, but they prefer to walk on the road as the pavement is not safe. ``Most of the holes in the pavement are visible only during daytime, and anyone falling in could have a serious accident, as there is no foothold below the pavement,’’ said K Thiagarajan of Anna Nagar. This long running pavement is at the entrance of many shops that have started dotting the area, many of them large shops, banks, bank ATMs, eateries, fruits stalls, grocery shops and medical shops. Most of these shops have used boards to close the holes in front of their shops, which makes them more dangerous. ``We did make some representations about two years ago, but nothing was done,’’ said Kumar, a shopkeeper. In places like the bus stop at Suguna store, the holes are big and can result in a person falling into it if the stone kept temporarily gets damaged or breaks, say these shopkeepers. Shanthi, who takes a bus regularly from the Suguna store bus stop, says she does not remember the last time she walked on the pavement. ``Sometimes when I see the bus and must run for it, chances are that I would fall into these holes. So I prefer to run on the middle of the road and stop it,’’ she said. The area is one that has become famous for window shopping, but the shoppers prefer to walk on the road and see the shops rather than on the platform due to its bad condition. ``It would benefit the shops if the people had closer access to the showcases, but the pavement situation makes it impossible,’’ said Krishna, a shopkeeper. City Engineer S Arasu said that the pavements would be surveyed and repaired after preparing an estimate at the earliest. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Southern TN districts continue Nipah sur.description: MADURAI: The officials from Kanyakumari, Tirunelveli and Theni health departments have said that the intense surveillance and monitoring for Nipah infection would continue across the three districts for a few more days as a precautionary measure. They mentioned that though no suspected cases of the infection have been reported, they would still be on alert. The officials said that in the three districts, all the hospitals, including the private and government institutions – would be closely monitored to check the fever patients and if they had shown Nipah infection symptoms.Deputy director of health services (DDHS), Tirunelveli district, Dr S Senthil Kumar said that mobile camps were still stationed at the Tamil Nadu-Kerala border to monitor the passengers travelling between both the states. “The situation is completely in control and even in Kerala, it is the same. We are just extending the surveillance and monitoring for a few more days as a precautionary measure,” he added. In Theni district too, officials said that mobile camps have been planned at least for a fortnight in the three Tamil Nadu-Kerala check posts. “Apart from this, the regular awareness activities are also on,” an official said. Meanwhile, at Kanyakumari, the officials said that they suspended checking the passengers at the border of the two states, but were having a close eye at the migrant labourers travelling between both the states. “The fever surveillance is being carried out across 150 hospitals,” district deputy director of health services (DDHS) Dr M Madhusoodanan said. HC quashes penalty order issued to ex-PI.description: Madurai: Observing that a notice was not served to the official before ordering penalty, the Madurai bench of Madras high court has quashed the penalty order issued to a retired public information officer (PIO). Petitioner T Pitchaiah was holding the post of PIO under Right to Information (RTI) Act in the Tiruvarur collectorate and had furnished certain information to an information seeker. Not satisfied with it, the information seeker approached the information commission to punish the petitioner. The directions issued by the commission were also not adhered to and in this regard, the counsel who appeared for the petitioner pointed out that a notice was received by the petitioner on December 8, 2008 asking him to appear on December 3, 2008 ! The counsel submitted that the successor of the petitioner who was holding the post of PIO failed to appear before the commission to produce the records. Thus, the petitioner cannot be blamed for the omission committed by his successor. The counsel further submitted that no notice or opportunity was given to the petitioner to be heard before being slapped the penalty and hence the penalty order issued in 2010 must be quashed. Justice S M Subramaniam observed that the court was of the considered opinion that no man should be punished unheard. “Statute provides that the central PIO or the state PIO as the case may be shall be given a reasonable opportunity of being heard before any penalty is imposed on him,” the judge said. Hence, the order of imposing penalty is not only improper but in violation to clause of Section 20 of RTI Act. The counsel who appeared for the petitioner brought to the notice of the court that the petitioner had already retired from service and now was a pensioner and therefore remanding the matter would not serve any purpose. The court noted that the additional government pleader was unable to establish that such a notice had already been provided to the petitioner before issuing the order of penalty. The court observed that this being the legal principle to be followed and the fact that the petitioner had already attained the age of superannuation and allowed to retire, no purpose would be served in remanding the matter now after a lapse of many years. Girl, 17, succumbs to burn injuries.description: MADURAI: A 17-year-old girl, from a village in Madurai district, died in a hospital late on Friday night after suffering from burn injuries in a fire accident that took place on Thursday. The accident took place when the girl set fire to garbage accumulated near her house. The victim was identified as C Lavanya, 17, from Vagaikulam near Kulamangalam in Madurai district police limits. She was studying in class 12 in a government-aided school in Chinna Chokkikulam in Madurai. The Alanganallur police registered a case under the section CrPc- 174- suspicious death and conducted an inquiry. According to the police, the girl cleaned the surroundings of her house and disposed the waste by setting fire to it. While, she was doing so on Thursday, fire spread to her dress. Soon it spread throughout her body. Her family members came to the rescue and put out the fire. She was immediately rushed to Government Rajaji Hospital, where she died on Friday night. A police officer said that a detailed inquiry was being conducted to ensure there was no foul play in the death. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

HC seeks state\u2019s response on direct.description: MADURAI: The Madurai bench of the Madras high court has sought a response from the state government to the anticipatory bail plea filed by director Pa Ranjith on Wednesday after the Thanjavur police registered a case against him for his controversial comment on king Rajaraja Cholan. When the petition was heard on Thursday, justice P Rajamanickam sought a response from the state and adjourned the case to June 19 for further hearing. The state also gave an undertaking before the court that they would not arrest Ranjith in connection with this case till June 19. Stating that he was invited to address the public to observe the death anniversary of T M Mani alias Umer Farook, founder of Neela Panpattu Maiyam at Thiruppananthal in Thanjavur district on June 5, Ranjith submitted that while addressing the meeting, he quoted some historical facts about king Rajaraja Cholan, which the prosecution felt would promote enmity between different groups of people. He also stated that the Thiruppananthal police registered a case under Sections 153 and 153 (A)(1)(a) of IPC. In his speech, Ranjth had said, “Our history has been teaching that king Rajaraja Cholan’s reign was a golden rule, but according to many social reformers, it was a black rule to the oppressed caste before most of their lands were acquired by the king. Moreover, during his reign, 400 women were branded as devadasis and 26 of them were sent to Kolar Gold Field.” He claimed that his speech was to create awareness about possession of land and only quoted the same from the history books. Hence, Ranjith had prayed to the court seeking anticipatory bail stating that he is willing to abide by the conditions imposed by the court. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lankan with fake passport arrested.description: MADURAI: A 48-year-old Sri Lankan national was arrested at Madurai airport on Saturday minutes before boarding a flight to Sri Lanka on a fake passport. He had obtained the passport by forging documents to show as if he was an Indian national. The accused was identified as S Jeyakanthan, 48, a Sri Lankan Tamil native of Jaffna. While immigration police led by inspector Victor detained him, Jeyakanthan was later handed over to the Perungudi police. Preliminary inquiries revealed that Jeyakanthan, in Sri Lanka, had married a woman from Karaikudi in Sivaganga district in 2003. After living one month in Sri Lanka, he came to Tamil Nadu along with his wife on spouse visa. While Jeyankanthan overstayed in India, the couple shifted to Tuticorin, where he was involved in poultry business. With his Sri Lankan passport being expired, he obtained fake documents like Aadhar and driving license. He later obtained passport using the documents. Fake cop arrested.description: Madurai: The Thirumangalam police, on Friday, arrested a man said to be in his 40s who dressed up as a cop and tried to loot money from people on the pretext of collecting fine by carrying out vehicle check. The accused was identified as Peter Raman, who hailed from Pollamangalam village near Chekkanoorani. According to the police, Raman was wearing a police costume and was enacting a vehicle check in two to three spots which were within the limits of Thirumangalam police station. While doing this at one of the spots, the general public were said to have grown suspicious and alerted the police. They rushed to the spot and arrested Raman. The police said that Raman had been involved in such practices earlier as well. New canteen opened at DPO: SP, Madurai, N Manivannan inaugurated a newly built canteen – which could be utilized both by the police personnel and the general public at the District Police Office in the city on Friday. The police officials said the canteen would provide food at a relatively subsidized cost and that it would be open from 7am to 7pm. Applications invited for temporary director post at MSU: The registrar of Manonmaniam Sundaranar University (MSU) S Santhoh Baboo informed that the candidates who have a teaching experience as associate professor/ professor for over 15 years in colleges/ university and below the age of 61 as on July 31, 2019 (including the eligible retired persons) could apply for the post of temporary director for integrated programmes in MSU. Filled in application should be sent to ‘The Registrar, MSU, Abhishekapatti, Tirunelveli 627 012’ on or before 5pm June 17. For other application details, long on to www.msuniv.ac.in. Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" \u201840% oral cancer cases in south Asi.description: MADURAI: Around 1,200 dental students participated in the two-day state-level conference, which began in Madurai on Saturday, and oral cancer, due to its high prevalence in the country, was one of the most discussed topics on the day. Students from a total of 30 colleges from Tamil Nadu and Puducherry participated in the ‘Impact 2019: 2nd Tamil Nadu State Indian Dental Association (IDA) Student Conference’. Speaking to TOI, the organizers said that though an array of topics on dental trends were spoken about during the programme, oral cancer was given a particular focus not only because of its prevalence but also because of certain misconceptions surrounding it. Dr R Yoganandha, secretary of IDA Thirumangalam branch, who is a part of the organizing committee, in fact, said that their association was particular about intensifying and coming up with several awareness and sensitization programmes regarding oral cancer because “30% to 40% of overall oral cancer cases across the world were from south Asian countries including India, Pakistan and Sri Lanka.” “While people immediately approach doctors when a particular wound in finger or any other part does not heal for a long time, when it comes to oral ulcer, which does not get healed for a long time, most opt self-treatment and think it will heal on its own,” he said and added that in such instances, they should immediately consult a dentist as on some occasions, there could be a possibility of oral cancer as well. The experts also said that people should be very careful because “pain on many occasions could occur only at the advanced stages during oral cancer”. As for the reason of the higher prevalence of oral cancer in the country, doctors said it was because of the large number of people using various forms of tobacco and not only as cigarettes. Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Employment below 18 years of age should.description: MADURAI: The NGOs that conducted the survey and the participants have collectively put forward seven suggestions that could end the 12 forms of exploitation against girls and women. Top priority should be given to ban employment of all those aged below 18 years. They suggested that ensuring quality and equal education free of cost would ensure children not going to work till they are at least 18 years old. Seeking reservation for girls in technical and higher education sector, they said that scholarships should be given to girls from socially and economically backward sectors. Recommending reservation for women in the government as well as private sector and equal wages for both men as well as women in the same category, they also suggested fixing the minimum wage of spinning mill workers at Rs 18,000 a month. They have also pressed for 50% reservation for women in all forms of elections. Offenders of child marriage cases should be punished. Full-fledged implementation of special acts such as Juvenile Justice Act and Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act will help reducing offences against children. They also pressed for creating awareness on these Acts among the public, especially among the rural populace. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Man held for hunting 6 peacocks for meat.description: MADURAI: Forest department personnel in Sivaganga have arrested a 26-year-old man for hunting peacocks. Forest range officer (FRO) of Sivaganga range V Gopinath said that the accused used a commonly available country-made gun illegally for hunting six peacocks. He hunted the schedule I species (under The Wildlife Protection Act, 1972) that are available in a sizeable number at Paluvur near Ilayangudi. The forest department personnel were engaged in vehicle checking near Kalayarkoil when they waved down a two-wheeler on which the rider had an unusually big bag. However, the man dodged them and fled. The forest personnel who went in search of him found the two-wheeler abandoned about 11 kms away and six dead pea fouls in the bag left behind. The accused was later nabbed at Velayuthampatti near Melur. Inquiries revealed that the flesh weight of the birds was about 3 kg to 5 kg each. Gopinath said that he wanted to process the bird’s meat by drying it with salt, store it and use it as it had a long shelf life. On the directions of district forest officer (DFO) D Rameshwaran, the accused was arrested, produced before the magistrate and lodged in jail under judicial custody on Wednesday. Officials said that the gun he used was the one used for balloon shooting game using pellets. Inquiries are under way to find out from whom he got the country-made gun. Fourteen peacocks and peahens have been killed by shooting or poisoning in the range since 2018. The department sources said that hunting peacocks could land the offender in jail for three to four years, in addition to coughing up a fine of up to Rs 50,000. Expressing concern over these incidents, the FRO said they were preparing awareness pamphlets for distribution. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

NIA questions Madurai man, raids house.description: MADURAI: Close on the heels of the searches and arrests carried out in Coimbatore after busting an Islamic State-inspired terror module, sleuths from the National Investigation Agency (NIA) questioned a man in Madurai city on Saturday night. A search was also conducted at his house at Villapuram area. Though the 20-year-old was let off after hours of quizzing, he has been asked to present himself for further questioning whenever required. A team from Kochi led by a deputy superintendent of police conducted the operation. A city police source said the man was picked up around 9pm and taken to the special investigation cell office at Tallakulam for interrogation. The NIA team left the city after the overnight inquiry. NIA sources said that the man, who is studying in an Arabic college, was suspected to have propagated IS ideology. He was found to have shared and liked the posts of Zahran Hashim, the mastermind of the Sri Lanka Easter terror attack case, on social media. However, his name has been withheld by the agency. “His father was also questioned. Since they have not been arrested or any substantial evidence secured against them, their names cannot be divulged. However, they have been asked to appear before us for questioning if needed,” the source said. As reported, two people identified as Mohammed Azaruddin and Shiek Hidayuthuallah from Coimbatore, have been arrested by the NIA following the searches so far. It had registered a case against six people in connection with propagating IS ideology on social media to inspire youths to join the terrorist organization, sources said. Citing a delay of 14 years, HC quashes r.description: Madurai: Observing that there was a delay of 14 years in passing the recovery order, the Madurai bench of Madras high court quashed the order passed for recovery of money from an official for causing financial loss while auctioning silk materials. The petitioner, K Rajan, moved the HC praying to quash the order of the assistant director of sericulture department, Trichy, to recover the financial loss during the course of the auction of silk materials from the petitioner. Rajan was employed as the junior inspector and was alleged of misappropriation of silk materials and was placed under suspension. A criminal case was registered against him during the year 1996 and the same was closed as barred by the law of limitation under section 468(2) CrPC during the year 2003. A revision petition filed by the police officials before the sessions judge at Trichy which was also dismissed during the year 2008. Due to which there is no criminal case pending against the petitioner. Departmental disciplinary proceedings was also initiated by an assistant director of sericulture against the petitioner. An enquiry was conducted and punishment of stoppage of increment for one year with cumulative effect was imposed on the petitioner and the alleged loss amount was also recovered from the petitioner. After a delay of 14 years from the date of the incident, an order dated 22nd March 2010 was passed stating that during the course of auction of the silk materials, the department sustained a financial loss and therefore the petitioner is liable to pay the loss amount occurred. Justice S M Subramaniam observed that the court is of the considered opinion that the departmental proceedings were already initiated against the petitioner and financial loss during the relevant point of time was assessed and the same was also recovered. The court further observed that now after a lapse of many years while auctioning the silk materials, the authorities cannot assess the financial loss as against the petitioner and recover the same. “Under these circumstances, any further recovery subsequently imposed in respect of the same silk materials cannot be sustained and the assistant director of sericulture, Trichy, is bound to initiate appropriate action against the officials who are all responsible for not assessing the financial loss against the petitioner during the relevant point of time and not auctioning the silk materials during relevant point of time to minimize the loss,” observed the judge. The judge noted that thus those officials who caused loss, undoubtedly must be held responsible for such loss and suitable action should be initiated by the head of the department in this regard. Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. 1 dead, search on for two others washed.description: MADURAI: One boy died and search is on for two more boys who were washed away by rough sea at Mandaikadu Pudur in Kanyakumari district on Sunday. The trio was among four boys of the village who were washed away. The boys Arockia Rexin, 11, Sagayarejin, 12, Rejith, 12, and Sachin, 14, from Mandaikadu Pudur were playing with a ball on the shore. When the ball landed in the sea, the four boys tried to retrieve the ball, but were unexpectedly dragged into the sea by an unusually big wave. The men in the coastal village managed to save Arockia Rexin. and also retrieved the body of Sachin. Colachel Marine Police were informed and search was on for the two boys till the late hours on Sunday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. House surgeons at TGMC allege sexual abu.description: Tuticorin: A group of final year women students who are on compulsory rotatory residential internship (CRRI) at the Thoothukudi Government Medical College (TGMC) in an unnamed complaint to the dean, have alleged sexual harassment by one of their assistant professors, who is also an orthopaedician and sought stringent action against him. According to the petition, seniors who have completed their course claimed that the doctor threatened them that they will not complete their MBBS degree if they did not heed to his ‘demands’. The petition also accused him of taking undue advantage of women attendants of patients, stalking the students, taking pictures and disturbing them through frequent calls and messages and taking the victims out with him. A copy of the petition was submitted to the college dean and superintendent of police of Tuticorin district. TGMC dean S Balasubramanian said a committee comprising three women doctors was formed to conduct an inquiry into these allegations. “We received the complaint a couple of days ago and formed the committee the same day,” he told TOI. “The committee conducted an inquiry with all the women house surgeons and the doctor who is facing the charges,” he said and added that the girls have given their version while the doctor has denied the allegations. The preliminary inquiry was completed on Friday and the report was sent to the DME the same day. “Action will be taken as recommended by the DME,” Balasubramanian added. Speaking to TOI, director of medical education (DME) A Edwin Joe said, “Severe departmental and legal action will be taken against the assistant professor if the sexual harassment charges against him are found to be true.” He said a probe has been ordered into the issue and is awaiting the report, based on which action would be taken. Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. Walking tracks planned at DPO\u2019s Sil.description: MADURAI: The tree saplings planted in ‘Silambu Solai’, a park created on the theme—Silapathikaram, Tamil literature -- with rare tree varieties a year ago, have been growing well. Many of the trees are now more than 15 feet tall. A range of trees, mentioned in a poem in the epic, was collected after a laborious search spanning months. The Madurai district police had created the park inside the district police office in Surveyor Colony and are now planning to inaugurate a canteen on Friday. Around 110 trees belong to 24 varieties mentioned in one of the poems in the epic’s Madurai Kandam section. The poem describes the plants and trees as: “Kuravamum, Vagulamum, Kongamum, Vengaiyum…… thannodu panmalar virindhu.” Despite rain playing truant this summer, the trees are well watered, thanks to the drip irrigation method. The park was the brain child of Madurai district superintendent of police N Manivannan, who closed down a defunct tank in front of the rural police office using 1,000 truckloads of soil and created the park in that space. The SP said that the canteen, for which they started construction soon after planting the trees last year, has also been completed. It will be thrown open on Friday. Snacks and food will be available at subsidized price. People, who come to petition him, can refresh themselves at the canteen and see the historical tree varieties, he said. Manivannan said that the trees have grown to an extent and they now plan to establish walking tracks using paver blocks. A plaque mentioning the name of each tree, its significance and the poem, where the species were featured in the epic will be erected. “Around 10% of the saplings did not survive, while others have grown well. Soon new saplings will be planted to compensate the withered ones,” Manivannan said. Silapathikaram’s author, Ilango Adigal, had named an array of flora found in the region when Kaundi Adigal ushered Kovalan and Kannagi in to Madurai. According to the epic, the couple arrived in Pandya kingdom from Chola kingdom to start their life afresh after losing their wealth. On finding a place to stay in the outskirts of the city, Kovalan alone entered the city to sell one of Kannagi’s anklets and start a business. Incidentally, Kadachanendal, where they are believed to have stayed, is located close to the Madurai district police office where the park is being developed. While Madurai has lost most of the legendary trees mentioned in the epic, they were procured from various parts of the state through a network of nature enthusiasts.
