Good response to English medium at corpo.description: MADURAI: The officials from Elango Corporation Higher Secondary School in Madurai have said that the demand for admissions at the school for higher secondary classes have significantly increased, after they introduced English medium this academic year. The school principal M Rajendran said that for Class XI, 70 new admissions have been made for English medium and that many more were expressing their wish to get admissions. “From next year, we are expecting more admissions for English medium than for the Tamil. One advantage with English medium having been introduced is that post completing SSLC, our students wouldn’t opt for other schools,” he added. Out of the 70 students, 40 opted commerce, accountancy, economics and business mathematics group, 15 for computer science, mathematics, physics and chemistry group and 15 for political science, economics, history and geography group. Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. 6 arrested for murder of DYFI functionar.description: Tirunelveli: Six people have been arrested by the city police in connection with the murder of Ashok, 25, the Tirunelveli district treasurer of the Democratic Youth Federation of India (DYFI). Commissioner of police N Baskaran told TOI that special teams are on the lookout for a few others. Baskaran said that the murder was a fall out of a clash between Ashok and one of the accused from the other community. “It is an issue between two families. Ashok and his mother were on a two-wheeler. His mother had a bundle of grass and this hit the person from the other community. Ashok’s mother was assaulted by the other person,” he said. Baskaran added that cases were registered on both sides and later Ashok attacked the other person, in retaliation to the attack on his mother. “Persons from both sides were arrested and they were released on conditional bail. While the other person was appearing in a police station in Madurai, Ashok was registering his signature in the Thachanallur police station,” he added. The accused were booked under Sections 302 (punishment for murder), 120(b) (punishment for criminal conspiracy), 147 (punishment for rioting), 148 (rioting armed with deadly weapons), 294(b) (uttering obscene language) and 506(ii) (punishment for criminal intimidation) of the Indian Penal Code and Sections. They were also booked under Sections 3(i), 3(i)s, 3(ii)5(a) of The Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, 1989. Meanwhile, the body of Ashok was laid to rest on Friday. The family and fellow villagers received the body from the Tirunelveli Government Medical College and Hospital on Friday morning after reaching a compromise with the police and district administration on Thursday night on meeting the eight demands put forth by them. Villagers and functionaries from DYFI, including national president Mohamed Riyas, and other CPM wings paid tributes to Ashok. Amidst heavy police protection to avert any clash, Ashok’s body was taken on a procession to Kariyiruppu, where it was buried. Following the burial of the youth’s body, police deployment in Kariyiruppu was reduced to 40 on Friday. However, police deployment will continue for a few more days till normalcy returns.
